page.title: 06Cults Church
page.content: For at least 800 years Cults Church has been standing in the tiny community of{Kirkton of Cults.}In early times Cults was spelt "Quilque", "Cultis",or "Quiltis". The present building was erected in 1793 and has changed little.A steep stone stair climbs the outside west wall up to the belfry.The inside of the small church is simply furnished with a gallery all the way round. On the walls inside the church are several memorials to the famous "Wilkie" family.{Rev.David Wilkie}was minister of the parish in 1774-1812. The present minister is the{Reverend {Iain Forbes}, who is minister to four combined parishes including Cults.Thus the church is no longer regularly in use.
